result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin Lee Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount $1,000, joint and several with Nathaniel McGahee (14CF1200), payable to victim, Marcus C.---to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Pay the balance of all applicable court cost, fees and surcharges--to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No contact with the victim, Marcus C.
No contact with the co-actor, Nathaniel McGahee.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously done)--to be paid over a period of probation. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights of suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; to be used at Probation Department's discretion

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin Lee Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request to Issue Civil Judgment for Restitution received and forward to Ali. os

Defendant Calvin Lee Brown in court with attorney John C. Glover.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state and defense counsel.
Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, straight time, with credit for 1 day time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 24 MONTHS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 4 MONTHS "condition time" - STAYED; to be used at Probation Department's discretion.
* No contact with the victim, Marcus C.
* No contact with the co-actor, Nathaniel McGahee.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,000.00, joint and several with Nathaniel McGahee (14CF1200), payable to victim, Marcus C. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge (unless previously done) - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given. 

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Calvin Lee Brown in court with attorney John C. Glover.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Calvin Lee Brown in court with attorney John C Glover.  Joanne L Hardtke for Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-22-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Calvin Lee Brown in court with attorney John C Glover.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense is awaiting discovery.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-20-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Calvin Lee Brown in court with attorney John C. Glover.  Benjamin Lindsay for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/9/14.
css

Defendant Calvin Lee Brown in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Sara Schroeder for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Due to a conflict with the State Public Defender's Office, Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw is granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/2/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Calvin Lee Brown in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Calvin Lee Brown in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
